title: Replacement Keyless ECM Setup Process

body.body: Replacement keyless ECMs can be setup using the Triumph diagnostic tool.
This instruction details the steps necessary to complete the setup process.
Before starting the setup procedure, make sure the battery voltage is at least 12.8 Volts.
An approved battery charger suitable for use with maintenance free batteries, may be used to maintain battery charge during the setup process.
Download and install the latest version of the Triumph diagnostic tool to your computer as described in the Triumph Diagnostic Tool Installation Guide.
Make sure you have all new keys ready.

A partial keyless ECM update is required to install the software necessary to allow the first key to be paired. It is not possible to complete the full keyless ECM download until after the first key has been paired.
Navigate to DOWNLOAD - KEYLESS ECM DOWNLOAD.
Use manual model selection to select the correct keyless ECM calibration for your model and region.
Press the power ON/OFF button on the motorcycle.
The motorcycle will not visibly power ON.
When prompted, turn the ignition OFF and click
Allow the download progress to reach 100%.
When prompted to present a key and turn the ignition On, click

body.name: Present key and Switch Ignition ON Screen - Cancel Button Highlighted

body.body: Press the power ON/OFF button on the motorcycle.
The motorcycle will not visibly power ON.
When immobiliser diagnostics has connected, click
Wait for the 300 second time delay to complete.
When prompted, place the smart key on the LF antenna to pair it.
Press and release the smart key button.
Do not exit the immobiliser diagnostic session.
Make sure the smart key is turned on and kept in range of the motorcycle for the remainder of this procedure.
It is now possible to download the full keyless ECM calibration.
Navigate to DOWNLOAD - KEYLESS ECM DOWNLOAD.
Use manual model selection to select the correct keyless ECM calibration for your model and region.
Follow all on screen instructions and allow the download to complete as normal.
Switch the engine stop switch to the RUN position.
Navigate to CHASSIS DIAGNOSTICS - IMMOBILISER DIAGNOSTICS - Configure.
Wait for the 300 second time delay to complete.
function to pair the two passive keys.
When paired, return to the Main Menu.
Check all ECMs for stored DTCs and erase as necessary.
Make sure that the engine can be started using each key. After each key is tested, turn the ignition OFF and allow one minute for the motorcycle to fully power down before testing the next key.
If fitted, set up the Tyre Pressure Monitoring System as described in the Triumph Diagnostic Tool User Guide.

metadata.products: PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1; PM1; PB1; DS4; DR4; D74; D71; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1
